review_title: One of The most intense VR driving
one_reviews_text:
The only thing missing with this simulation is the G force chair ! With the force feedback wheel set at 100% in your favourite WRC car, a 7 minutes drive of Dirt Rally 1.0 will make you sweat in your own living room !

The good thing about Dirt Rally 1.0 vs 2.0, I can set the graphics preset at ULTRA, and the GPU is still capable of 'rendering' 90+ FPS.

If I want the same graphics quality in Dirt Rally 2.0 without the Famous studder issue, I need to set all the settings to Ultra as well (Wait, what ? ) and force Oculus  Rift to run at 45 FPS instead normal 90 FPS.  The difference ? 1 image every 22.22 ms is 45 FPS (Very stable) , or 1 image every 11.11 ms is 90 FPS with possible frame lost/drop and Timewarp lag (when Oculus Rift ASW kick in and out, beam me up Scotty).

How fast can you process and react to what you see when you drive at 100 mph on rally track ? Well, See you in Dirt Rally 1.0 !

Windows 10(1909),  i7- 7700K OC at 4.66 GHz, 32GB Ram, Nvidia GTX 1080 Ti (11GB), 2xM2 Drives, 3x 2K Display, Logitech G29 Wheel + G25 for Shifter only, USB Arduino Made in China Handbrake, USB Arduino SKRS Shifter
Great racing game but really hard and you need to have strong VR legs for this one. A nice set of courses with good track variations and lots of settings.

What we have here is, at it's core, the most immersive racer in VR. I loved it on Psvr but now on Rift S we are talking about the real thing. If you got a T150 racing wheel or better and are able to change some options (what not everybody here seems to be capable of) then you will be rewarded with one of the finest racers in gaming history. It reminds me of good old Colin McRae Rally in every good aspect. *warning* the game is challenging! (For T150 users: you have a preset for the wheel. This and turning the (german translation) steering saturation to 25 does a beautiful job)

It actually a fan of this game.  Driving is perfect for VR.  The corners can be hard to determine in some locations, due a bit more to the screen door effect than anything.  And while it will work in Ryzen game mode, it won't work on anything more than 20 cores, and it's not worth it to go back and forth for just one game.

....even on low graphics settings ! I have this already on the Steam platform and for some reason it doesn't perform very well in VR via the Oculus Rift S, unless I was just having a bad day with the ole peepers !

This was on sale recently for £7.99 and I thought it was well worth trying it from the Oculus store and as long as I don't play for more than 2 hours if it looked rubbish I can at least apply for a refund.

I'm running a intel i5 - 4670k overclocked to 4ghz, MSI Nvidia GTX 970 4GB graphics card ( set to vr mode using the msi gaming app ) , 16gb dual core memory and a Samsung SSD ....I have the graphics set to medium and I have to say the game runs very smoothly and the graphics look great. I control the game with a Logitech G29 and that works flawlessly. The graphics suffer very little distance blurring that I used to get on my Lenovo WMR explorer headset, looks a lot crisper which enhances the immersion even more. 

Very pleased with this purchase.

Played this in VR for a while, gave up on it and moved it to another drive.  
Today I had the chance to buy a G29 steering wheel, pedal and shifter combo for dirt cheap, and WHAT A MASSIVE DIFFERENCE!!!  The feedback when haring round corners and then letting the steering wheel glide naturally back through your grip - feeling every bump - until you're ready to accelerate again just blew me away.  An absolute defining moment in gaming for me.

review_title: HOLY S**T I’M GOING TO THROW UP
one_reviews_text: They weren’t lying. It’s so intense that it’s almost unplayable.

Very fun experience, captures a lot of what I imagine rally driving is like. The co-driver calls add an interesting layer of focus to the game. Racing in VR is notorious for making people sick, I had some of that initially in DiRT Rally but kept going long enough that it's gone away.

The main thing missing for me right now is cloud saves. I play on two separate rigs and my "career" is not synced between them.

review_title: Best racing game on the Rift
one_reviews_text:
Simply awesome, I forced super sampling 2.0 and was ready to face trouble when cranking up graphics to Ultra. But that didn't happen - the game performed smooth as butter, I did disable antialiasing though, the game worked fine with MSAAx2, but looked too blurry - and with super sampling 2.0 you don't need more antialiasing in this game. So graphics are awesome - and this game should perform great on all kind of hardware at or above minimum requirements. My specs: GTX 1080 (heavily oc'ed to 2100 Mhz boost and 11 Ghz mem), i7 7700K (4.5 Ghz), 16GB PC3200. 
In-game you can't change view, so you're stuck inside the car - but that's exactly what you are when driving in the real world. This game really feels like being there - directly participating as a race driver. 
I didn't pay the full price for this game - now I feel kinda bad. This game is truly worth the full price - and more. If you buy one racing game for the Rift, Dirt should be that game! Don't worry about the missing Touch support - this game really shines with a gamepad.

I think that the installation can be difficult for those that never played the game in non VR. The game does not recognize the monitor resolution automatically, in my case a 4k monitor, in the very beginning I was on the floor (sic), I had to tell in the options that my monitor was 4k and then I could see the way.

So, I played this for about 45 minutes, yes, I know that isn't enough time to really give a review but I would like to give my first impressions which is that this game is fun, but for a beginner it is kind of hard. And it doesn't really teach you how to do stuff. Also the graphics are kind of bad but I suppose that could be just because the game is old. I have everything on ultra and the most it can be but still isn't too nice. The game also has a bland sense of color as it all is kind of...meh.

But if you can overlook all those things this game is fun. It gives a great racing experience if you know what your doing and it definitely is fun for VR.

review_title: Decades out of racing game, same bad AI
one_reviews_text: General this game is nice. Haven'T bought any racing games for decades, i think my last one was Colling McRae's Dirt, 1 or 2 on PS3 if i remember, but, i drop down stars on this game for the simple reason, even about 10+ years after my last racing game, developpers seems to be using the same old AI codings, like graphics evolves, etc.. but AI coding stays the same pile of..., AI'S using Armored Vehicules.. i mean, i'm casual player for racing games, so getting racing skrewed up because AI'S make sme loose controls, and i can't make them loose any, they can ram me like a tank and make me do a total 360 etc.. but i can't push them as much as i can to give me any advantage to cheat as they are... Well, sadly the RallyCross section of the game is a total piece of crap, good thing is, in normal Rally you don'T physicly face them. But honestly Dev's, try out the games AI'S before making it public, it's a lot frustration facing AI'S in their M1 Abrams versus me in my little Clio :)

DiRT Rally on the Oculus Store is the VR-only port of the popular DiRT Rally title. This review will have 3 parts: #1 about other reviews and hardware, #2 about gameplay, and #3 about performance/issues.

1) The reviews on here are very mixed, including multiple "game doesn't launch" reviews, but take them with a grain of salt. The game runs if you have decent hardware. I have an i7-4790K @ stock 4.0GHz, 16GB of DDR3 RAM, a GTX 1070, and the 2016 consumer model Oculus Rift on Windows 10, and the game runs fine.

2) The gameplay is incredible. Even on low-medium settings, it's very immersive, intense, and fun. This version is VR-only, so if you get nauseous in VR easily, I would recommend trying the Steam version, which you can play non-VR. If you don't get nauseous often in VR, or never get nauseous, then I absolutely recommend trying this game out if you're interested in racing/driving games. It's hard to describe how much fun this game is, try watching some videos about it. It's arguably better than any other racing sim game. And if you have the money to spend, get a wheel/pedal setup. I got mine for $346 after playing for a couple hours, totally worth it (Keyboard+Mouse works, recommend FFB Wheel or Gamepad, does NOT work w/ Touch controllers).

3) Performance wise, don't expect amazing graphics unless you have a GPU better than a 1070. I run on low-med settings, and the lowest I get is 86 fps in forests (lots of trees). Shadows look terrible unless set to Ultra, as do other things, but your car moves so fast that you won't really notice. At night, I sometimes have reflection issues when my car lights overlap with other lights, but otherwise it's great. Also, the lack of Steam workshop support (for obvious reasons) means you can't download tuning presets (you have to learn how to tune suspension, brakes, etc yourself via menus), and you have to cover the headset sensor to navigate menus while not wearing it.

That being said, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game!

review_title: Don't listen to the one star reviews...
one_reviews_text:
All of the one star reviews are for small problems that are easily fixed.
Yes...you can use a wheel, pedals, and stick shift.
Yes...you can play seated once you reset your view.
Yes...the game is challenging and requires lots of practice.
Yes...the comfort level is intense so you have to get used to the motion.
Yes...the game is great!

If you have problems, I might be able to help! Hit me up!

So it seems many people gave this game mixed reviews they couldn't play the game or it wasn't comfortable to them, I would like to say this game is amazing. If you have trouble with comfortability during play time (getting dizzy, headaches etc.) maybe this game isn't for you, but this is NOT the games fault. The game for what it is is the most fun I have ever had playing a racing game....ever. Hands down an amazing experience and I was immediatly hooked. If you like rally or racing games in general, this game is awesome.

review_title: Does NOT support desktop mode. (VR Only)
one_reviews_text: I was really disappointed to find out this game is VR only. Also, I had to stand up to see through the windshield in the game. I would have to like to play sitting down. Other than that, great game.
Playing this with a racing wheel and pedals is an absolute blast

Update: Dropped a star because of 2 issues, 1.There is an annoying circular image on the edge of my view it goes all the way around the screen. 2. sometimes your car get written off by just running off the track, say, down the side of a hill. This means if you are on race 6 and it happens, you lose the whole season. Original review: Looks great once adjustments are made. Fun as hell, intense. I am very sensitive to motion sickness, get basically none in this, although I always play in over car view, which is always my favorite view in racing games. Right at the top of the list for fun VR games and best VR racer I've tried so far, by ALOT.
Game doesn't start, I can't go beyond the warning sign, waist of time and space.

review_title: Probably one for the real enthusiasts...
one_reviews_text:
Within about 5 minutes of loading up, I could tell this one wasn't for me... Having played a ton of VR games already, I was keen to test out some driving / racing games, however I think somehthing like this is just far too indepth for me... So much focus on the minute details of your cars, equiptment, racing team etc. which would be fine in a desktop driving sim but for me, there's just far too much micro management to be enjoyable in a VR experience. I'm sure if you're REALLY into rally / driving sims, you'll love this - However for me, just someone who wanted to experience driving in VR - it's just far too in-depth. Which of course is not a bad thing, if that's what you're after. 

My reason for only three stars however, is having played 20-30 VR titles already (including flight / space sims), this is the first to give me real bad motion sickness. I had to stop playing after about 3 mins into my first race.

The driving and experience as a whole did seem immersive overall however, just not for me I'm afraid.
I am having trouble with this game, went to you tubes videos, not for sure what i am doing wrong. I still am having problem with this game, have never played it yet, can I get some help!!!!

Project Cars can of takes the fun out of racing with the pro physics, but so far this one is like chess ultra. You want to come back. Doe's not support or notice steering wheel by thrus master at this time just hand x-box contoller. IT WOULD BE NICE ON HOW TO START THE RACE .!

i cant find way to start!!! i try all the button :(
i already miss my money....dont try it:(

i cant even play the game it keep crashing what a waste of $15 dollars
Touch Controllers are not supportet!! Bad experience. Got nauseated almost immediately!
2 days now----still "installing" :(

For everyone complaining about the game You have to understand that this is a VR PC game and adjustments will have to be made for your set up. I would recomend a high end GPU and lots of ram!!! But most imporantly, take the time to set everything for your comfort.. After that the game is AMAZING!!!

The next game i purchase will be PCR VR, because I don't know that I can go off of the reviews on the home store due to the ratings on this game! All in all, I love this game. I use the Logitech stearing wheel and pedals to make the experiance more realistic with the oculus headset.
This Title rocks. The one and only thing I wish the publishers had done is that they had included more hillclimb events. The Rallycross is meh. However the rally section is great FUN

review_title: Game works, worth buying after U fix it
one_reviews_text:
I fixed the game on my end by deleting all Dirt Rally files I can find, and reinstalling the game again. The game only downloads once and they know the root cause on their end and working on a fix. They think they will have it fixed in 24 hours or at least by Monday. They will give a refund if it is not fixed if you ask.  
Delete old downloaded files and do a fresh download/install. Remember if it never installs after you first download the game, then your file or the file you have is bad. They may have updated the install file to a newer version other than version 1.0 as Steam version is I think 1.23 or higher. 
FILE #1: C:\Program Files\Oculus\Software\Software/_Solvettube.com_Dirt_Rally FILE #2: C:\Program Files\Oculus\Software\Downloads\87badfe745d6516e699fb19bdf85f1d6b5fa2c30f37c22ae93dbe48532233777

Like most other people I've been having trouble with this game. I figured it looked like fun and it was cheap so I thought that maybe they had fixed it. 
Idk if they fixed it yet or not, but I was able to download the game no problem, but when I hit run it would crash at the loading screen. Idk what the problem is and untill they fix it I'm gonna keep the 1 star rating.

Also I sent a feedback to Oculus so we will see how they respond.

I was wary of buying this in the summer sale due to the high number of complaints saying the game didn't load. Whatever the problems were it has been fixed now and it is a gripping and thrilling game. If you've got the graphics card to power it at max settings with 1.5 supersampling it's a beautiful game with tons of different cars, tracks and variety. Absolutely a AAA title and probably my favourite game so far. Months worth of gameplay in this one.
window pops up saying it cant run

Why can't I play this in nonVR mode? I paid 60 bucks for the full game, not just the VR part.

Steam offers both.. Why doesn't this store?

And I don't see an easy way to get a refund. Your forum was incorrect on refund instructions.

This game was clearly not designed for VR from the bottom up. It's kind of just mashed into a VR experience. The scale is off and it feels like everything is kind of just a little too small - the cars, the roads and maps... everything. I might be able to overlook that if the game controls were good, but unless you have a steering wheel controller you're gonna spend most of your time in the ditch.

I like many thousands of people had issues installing the game, but once that issue was resolved it was off to the races. I gave 4 stars for a very good driving experience. Pros & cons below:
Pros:
1. Very nice graphics (scenery looks fantastic)
2. Great drive (Gamepad recommended, I do not have steering wheel)
3. Awesome race tracks with various difficulties.
4. Really feels like you are in the driver seat.
Cons:
1. About the driver seat. You have to stand to properly see out the window.
2. No support for touch contollers (really bummed out about that)
3. Not able to change POV position (ie. 1st person vs. 3rd person) 
4. Driver animation looks funny.
Verdict:
Money well spent for this highly immersive VR experience. This game will provide countless hours game play.

This was the first high dollar game I bought and should have listen to the reviews that the game didnt install . Oculus does not give refunds for software they want to try and fix your problem so far no fix on the internet  and Im still working on it and Im getting support through email which is taking way to long. Before you take a chance and buy this game thinking your going to get it to work like I did and its a non Oculus touch game I would buy it on Steam they support most steering wheels and the Xbox one controller. Listen to the consuming reviewers BEWARE DO NOT BUY THIS GAME your taking a chance unless you like fixing other companys software issues I do not and support is not that good.

Is instead of pulling the game of the store until its patched and fixed they cut the price in half so more people will buy and then complain that it doesn't work because well.....it doesn't work.  My brother bought this game last week and had the same issue.  He did a charge back and got a refund.  Fast forward a week later and its on sale andd guess what?  I buy it.  Still not installing though.  Really blows my mind.  Really not impressed with the Rift at all.  I'm probably going to return it.

Now fixed after logging a ticket.  Issue solved by Oculus Suport.  Great Game - upgrading to 5 Stars.

High end PC and tried install 4-5 times, gets to 100% and fails.  Logged a ticket.  Apparently there is a fix due in 24-48hrs.

Hello,

To provide an update on this, we have found the root cause on our end and we are working on a fix on our end.

Please allow us 24 hours to update this on our end. Once you are able to install the software, or if you continue having difficulties installing the software on Monday, please let me know.

I'll await your response.

Oculus Support

Everything has just been fixed by Oculus! Things are back to normal now, the game installs perfectly!

Now let's talk a little about the game. The car choices are pretty large dating from old to new rally cars, you have three amazing game modes. The immersion is just outstanding, this is BY FAR the best simulation game for dirt racing, if not one of the best racing simulators. With no doubt DiRT Rally is worth the money it asks for, this is a must have if you are a racing enthusiast.
Works really bad in VR, couldnt even use my touch controllers. And the motion sickness is real. Could play for 1minute..

(yes i had trouble installing first, too - but finally it worked) I just had my first few hours with the game and after cranking the graphics up it looked spectacular. Using a Logitech Driving Force GT Wheel it was really a pleasure to drive around the tracks. At the moment I am still slightly overwhelmed by the quick curves, all the informations my co-driver gives me and so on, but I am getting better and better and I just love the overall feel. This game truely deserves 5 stars and if you are a driving fan, for the current price it is a must buy!
I contacted Oculus yesterday and it was fixed in less then 24 hours very fast response time and this is a very great and realistic driving simulator.

Do not take the intense comfortability rating likely. This game did not take long for me to feel nausceous and i have been fine on most games. If you can, turn up the graphics and the game looks a ton better. 
The only con i have is that the oculus touch controllers dont have support yet. I feel like the immersive experienced is hindered by it

In August I purchased this game, and it flat out would not install, a few other reviewers had the same problem.  After seeing mostly positive reviews today, I downloaded it again, and it installs and works flawlessly. It's not everything I had hoped it would be, but it works now. Some aspects of the graphic design are poor, such as the interior of the car, co-driver, spectators, but when you're racing across a snow-covered, country road the last thing on my mind is my co-drivers oddly shaped hands, and lack of personality. As for motion sickness, I've only had had an issue my first couple races, and haven't had a problem with it since. Minecraft is actually more unsettling to me. 

If you buy this game, I hope you enjoy it. The races are very challening, and it does provide  many hours playability while trying to work up the ranks and purchase new cars, and upgrades.
i have no idea what's wrong with the game. i had tried a hundred times for install.but.......some one hellp me please, and how to do return the game?

4 stars for now for swift support and a promising game

If you actually know how to drive a car then this is one of the best rally games you can play, even with a controller it's a great simulation, has tons of optional assists, & in-depth car configuration. Driving quickly on those narrow roads is quite the thrill. Some minor issues; the graphics are a bit weak; the FOV is a slightly lower than the Rift's FOV, so you can see the view is shaped like a circle; & the game is quite blurry without supersampling. 9/10 would reccomend.

Be ready for a good workout...this stuff is as intense as competitive rally should be. 5 stars well deserved !!

review_title: Horrible, do not download from Oculus!
one_reviews_text: Download this game from Steam. Hard to navigate. Have to reconfig my Fanatec wheel and remap everything everytime I load the game. It allows me to save my wheel settings but no way to load it when I start up the game. I can see it but whatever button I press cannot load the game. Would have been fine if I could use a mouse but this is Oculus only. Good game but have to take 10 minutes everytime to remap my wheel.
To be played with Wheel N such, AMAZING Game.
Codemasters know how to do a rally game. No issues on install works great with G27.

I've always kind of had a thing for racing games. I played WAY too many hours of GranTurismo over the last decade and a half or more. This game was kind of tough at first, but after putting a few hours into it, I really love it. The only thing that could possibly be any better would be Dirt 4. I PRAY that Dirt 4 gets released for Rift as well. There's absolutely nothing like it. I just feel way more in tune with my car. Enough that I was thinking about getting a steering wheel and/or pedals. If Dirt 4 gets released for Rift, I may make the jump. Until then, I'm still loving Dirt Rally. I've probably got more hours in this game than any 2 other games combined.

You really need to include the 2D desktop version when paying top price for a game like this so you can play without the vr on all the time. I wish I bought it on steam as that includes both version for the same price.
UPDATE: The game no longer gets past the comfort screen so I guess we were only renting it!
Do not buy this.

review_title: My favorite VR game so far
one_reviews_text:
Great rally racing game for those who seek a realistic simulation. Nice graphics, fantastic sound. The rally tracks are faithful renderings of real life tracks, same with the cars.
This game is hard. Due to the realism it requires dedication to learn how to drive a rally car. Steering wheel highly recommended, though XBOX controller is still viable.

I played with Dirt3 (not for VR) in the past and I have to say that the graphics was better than in this version. The menu design is more than minimal and uses very ugly textures. Meshes, textures and shaders are really far from the realism achieved on Dirt3.   The game is quite difficult to play even with a steering wheel. Ok Dirt isn't an easy game we all know that but this it really tricky.
As in the other codemasters games force feedback is perfect and the physics two.
I think that codemasters can do better than this so please Update it as soon as possible!
If textures, meshes and menus will be improved the game will be a masterpiece. 
I am waiting!

I must admit that I'm not a big fan of car games.This game is disapointing. Despite the fact that it's too difucult to control the cars with the gamepad, I wasn't able to setup  the game in VR as expected due to the lack of options.

I've reached out to the developer several times, both on the forums and via their tech support email address, and I've gotten no response. I've tried every possible suggested fix that the developer has posted.
I want to use desktop mode to setup my wheel (logitech G27) so I don't need to keep taking the headset on and off to refer to the browser and profiler, but the option is not there! please add it!
This game is too bumpy for VR.  Its nausiating to the point of being unplayable.  Smooth out the bumpy ride and just make the controller vibrate.

Overall, this is a great game that you can get a lot of play time out of. 

My only complaints are that the graphics could be better and that your steering wheel motion does not sync up well with the virtual model.
